messages: 8e9a5ab9acb0d38c096cb0f02406514e (17:27): do you know if it's supposed to be possible for browsers to view video in fullscreen? I mean, that there is anything in the specs for that?

a59a559d5e93797d3335ccffe1bca7b1 (17:47): 8e9a5ab9acb0d38c096cb0f02406514e: Used to be in the spec that there should not be a JS API to trigger fullscreen mode. That was removed, but there is no specified way to implement such a feature AFAIK. If you use native browser controls, then most will provide a FS control among them.
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (18:03): im struggling with creating a brush for canvas, but not sure what the most proper way is to create a gradiented brush
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (18:03): currently im interpolating between brush events, but that sucks
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (18:05): i tried interpolating with arc and with a radial gradiented rect, but its not ideal
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (18:07): bottomline is how to create a soft brush without interpolation errors

8e9a5ab9acb0d38c096cb0f02406514e (18:16): a59a559d5e93797d3335ccffe1bca7b1, that there should _not_ be a JS API to trigger fullscreen? Why on earth .. What's the point of that? It's quite common to watch video in fullscreen.
a59a559d5e93797d3335ccffe1bca7b1 (18:17): 8e9a5ab9acb0d38c096cb0f02406514e: Phishing. Go to page, trigger a video of a Windows desktop with IE maximised on it. It is, or was, an issue with Flash.
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (18:18): who is the dood tho seems to have lots of followers for someone without a blog :)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:25): Well, we're working on a fullscreen API
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:26): Which either asks the user or doesn't have keyboard access
